title: Macron contemplates cabinet reshuffle
summary: Amid mounting pressure from the immigration bill's controversy, the French president is contemplating replacing Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne to rejuvenate his administration.

title: Taiwan's young voters prepare for pivotal election, ambivalent about China and their future
summary: These young Taiwanese in their twenties are preparing to vote in their first election on January 13. While they are aware of the threat China poses to their island and its democracy, they are nevertheless seduced by their powerful neighbor's culture and promises of prosperity.

title: Golden Globes 2024 tries to win back viewers' favor with new award for box-office hits
summary: For the first time, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association will be giving an award for 'Cinematic and Box Office Achievement'.

title: Cambodia: Traditional villages in Angkor under threat
summary: The Cambodian authorities have launched a major project to relocate the residents of the archaeological site of the renowned Angkor temples, where the number of illegal constructions has surged.

title: US Congress announces spending agreement that could avert government shutdown
summary: Congressional leaders reached a crucial spending agreement to avert a government shutdown but face a tight deadline to enact the deal into legislation before January 19.

title: Companies imitate luxury hotel room service to entice employees back to the office
summary: Covid-19 has permanently kept employees away from their open-plan offices. To reverse the trend, some employers are drawing on the luxury hotel industry's practices.

title: Israel-Hamas war: US Secretary of State Blinken warns that conflict could spread throughout Middle East
summary: The top US diplomat spoke in Qatar on the latest leg of his fourth Middle East tour since the start of the war aimed at de-escalating the conflict.

title: Why the EU is banning glitter
summary: To reduce microplastic pollution, the European Union is gradually banning these shiny particles, starting with 'loose glitter'.

title: From Paris to Marseille, French museums report record attendance in 2023
summary: Most of France's cultural institutions, in Paris and in the rest of the country, have regained their pre-pandemic visitors.

title: The 'disobedient' children of Argentina's torturers
summary: The daughters and sons of men accused of actively participating in repression during the dictatorship (1976-1983) are slowly discovering a past that has long remained secret. Some don't hesitate to disown their fathers.

title: Disappearance of local newspapers is weighing on US democracy
summary: One in five Americans lives in an area lacking in news coverage. As the November 2024 presidential election approaches, initiatives are springing up to reverse the trend.

title: After rift caused by Depardieu, how can French cinema pick up the pieces?
summary: The accusations against the actor and the flurry of letters and op-eds have shaken France's cultural world, which was thought to be relatively united. How do you work together after such a debacle?

title: Bangladesh's Hasina wins re-election after polls boycotted by opposition
summary: Hasina's ruling Awami League 'has won more than 50 percent seats,' an Election Commission spokesman said on Sunday, with counting ongoing.

title: Mental training for athletes, a business exploited by 'charlatans'
summary: The absence of an official mental trainer certification leads to diversity in the qualification of practitioners, a situation prone to abusive tactics.

title: EU Council President Charles Michel to step down early
summary: The Belgian has announced that he will step down early as European Council president after running in the European Parliament elections in June, raising questions about who will take over.

title: Nadal out of Australian Open with muscle tear
summary: The tennis champion had made his comeback from a year-long injury absence just a week ago.

title: Iranian woman gets 74 lashes for 'violating public morals'
summary: Roya Heshmati was also ordered to pay a fine for 'not wearing the Muslim veil in public,' her lawyer said.

title: Our selection of the 15 best galettes
summary: There are those who swear by the traditional frangipane, those who like the originality of an ice cream or crumbly galette and those who are after a gluten-free or chocolate option. Follow the guide to find your favorite... and the hidden lucky charm!

title: French parents suspected of planning infanticide stun their village
summary: Florian L. and Marie L., owners of a music school in the village of Carcans in southwestern France, were arrested in Spain in December 2023 for allegedly planning to 'sacrifice' their 'possessed' 5-year-old child in Morocco, a claim doubted by relatives.

title: Turkish TV series is exposing deep societal divides
summary: Banned episodes and a flood of social media commentary... 'Kizil Goncalar' (Red Buttons) sheds a harsh light on the Islamic religious brotherhoods who are staunch government supporters, sparking outrage in conservative circles.

title: 2030 Olympics in the Alps: The risk of a poisoned chalice
summary: The likely selection of France for the Winter Olympics, merely six years following the Summer Games in Paris, is raising a myriad of objections.

title: Golden Globes 2024: 'Oppenheimer' and 'Barbie' lead the way
summary: Christopher Nolan won best director for 'Openheimer' while 'Barbie' won a newly created award for the year's highest-grossing movie. French courtroom drama 'Anatomy of a Fall' won best screenplay.

title: Vladimir Putin visited a military hospital. Does anyone care?
summary: On January 1, the Russian president went on an early morning visit to a military hospital near Moscow, to extend his New Year wishes.

title: US, Brazil, Mexico, India: 2024 will be a record election year
summary: This year, half of the world's population that is of voting age will be called to the polls in free or pre-determined elections.

title: The relentless struggle of South Sudanese displaced by war and endless flooding
summary: Since 2021, unprecedented flooding has engulfed Bentiu, the capital of Unity State and the surrounding area. Villages, forests, farmland and animal herds were submerged in a matter of days. The water never completely receded.

title: Golden Globes 2024: Justine Triet's 'Anatomy of a fall' wins two awards
summary: Christopher Nolan's film dominated the evening with five Golden Globes, while French director Triet's wins (Best Foreign Film, Best Screenplay) are good news for the Oscar race.

title: With Vulcan Centaur, US relaunches its plan to conquer the moon
summary: The rocket lifted off from Cape Canaveral on Monday. This mission symbolizes the new American strategy of linking the private sector with its public programs.

title: US election: Even before the Republican primaries, the Biden-Trump confrontation is already taking hold
summary: The former president was in Iowa, where his main Republican rivals, Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley, are holding a series of public meetings. Meanwhile, the Democratic president made an unofficial campaign debut in Pennsylvania.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Blinken returns to Middle East seeking to prevent spread of war in Gaza
summary: On Friday, the US Secretary of State began a new tour of the region – his fourth since October 7 – to prevent other fronts in Lebanon, Syria, Iraq and Yemen from flaring up.

title: Our best addresses for raisin bread
summary: With blond or brown raisins, rum or Madagascar vanilla pastry cream, abundant filling or crispy puff pastry... Where in France can you enjoy a delicious raisin bread?

title: Macron urges French to work out in Olympic year
summary: Officials in the president's office said the government had already met the target it set in 2017 to have 3 million more people exercising regularly and was now aiming for another 3 million by 2027.

title: Lula's first year in Brazil: Encouraging but fragile results
summary: Growth and employment are better than expected, and deforestation is slowing down in the Amazon. However, the country remains politically divided, and the president has to deal with a Congress that remains dominated by the opposition.

title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says commander killed in Israeli strike
summary: The Israeli military did not immediately comment on the commander's death.

title: One day, there was a miracle: 'I was reading Le Monde at a crosswalk and a stranger saved my life'
summary: Sixteen years ago, Jérôme, now 52, would have been hit by a bus had it not been for the timely intervention of a passer-by.

title: Anti-Semitism: Jean-Luc Mélenchon's choice of ambiguity
summary: Over the past 10 years, the left-wing leader has made several remarks that echo anti-Semitic stereotypes, causing incomprehension even among his own base and, for the past three months, irritating a wide swathe of public opinion.

title: New US moon mission runs into technical trouble
summary: The Astrobotic company behind the project announced on Monday that its Peregrine spacecraft has experienced an 'anomaly.'

title: Boeing shares sink almost 9% after latest safety incident
summary: The incident on an Alaska Airlines flight late Friday, January 5, which miraculously led to no fatalities or serious injuries, has pushed the Dow down, as well as also driven tumbles in shares of Boeing subcontractor Spirit AeroSystems and Alaska Airlines.

title: Actor Idris Elba demands tougher action on knife crimes after spate of teen killings in Britain
summary: The star joined protestors from the Don't Stop Your Future campaign at a demonstration on Monday. In the English capital, 18 teenagers were stabbed to death in 2023.

title: Why Middle East stability revolves around Israel
summary: Le Monde looks back at the history of Israel's relations with its Arab neighbors and the intractable and complicated quest for peace in the Middle East, made of alliances and betrayals.

title: French PM Elisabeth Borne resigns
summary: Prime Minister Borne had been anticipated as due to leave office soon, after a meeting on Sunday with President Emmanuel Macron, which likely concerned a much-awaited cabinet reshuffle that could relaunch Macron's political momentum.

title: Franz Beckenbauer, German football legend, dies at 78
summary: Beckenbauer, one of the few football greats to win the World Cup as a both player and a coach, passed away peacefully in his sleep following years of health complications, according to a statement by his family.

title: Ethiopia holds military talks with separatist region of Somalia
summary: Following landlocked Ethiopia's controversial deal on sea access with the breakaway region of Somaliland, their army chiefs met on Monday. Meanwhile, Somalia's President visited neighboring Eritrea, seeking support against Ethiopia.
